Name: Painted wooden figure of a bird
Description: Wooden image of a bird, possibly the ibis, painted in black and white on both sides. Although ibis images are most common in the Late Period, the style and flat form of this example finds closer parallels in the late 18th Dynasty. A spoonbill of similar style, now in the Brooklyn Museum, was uncovered in excavation of the palace of Amenhotep III at el-Malqata.
